article_title: Swedish FSA investigates Nordea after Panama Papers leak
article_text:
The information about Nordea was included in a leak of more than 11.5 million documents from the files of law firm Mossack Fonseca, based in Panama.

"We take this extremely seriously," said Christer Furustedt, head of the FSA department overseeing major Swedish banks.

Nordea was fined the maximum 50 million crowns ($6.14 million) in May 2015 for deficiencies in its approach to tackling money laundering.

(Reporting by Simon Johnson; Editing by David Goodman)

og.description: The information about Nordea was included in a leak of more than 11.5 million document

article_summary:
Nordea was fined the maximum 50 million crowns ($6.14 million) in May 2015 for deficiencies in its approach to tackling money laundering.
"We take this extremely seriously," said Christer Furustedt, head of the FSA department overseeing major Swedish banks.
The information about Nordea was included in a leak of more than 11.5 million documents from the files of law firm Mossack Fonseca, based in Panama.
(Reporting by Simon Johnson; Editing by David Goodman)
